title: Toney gets redemption, lifts Miami to first CFP win
content: Malachi Toney's tiebreaking 11-yard touchdown with less than two minutes left sent No. 10 seed Miami past No. 7 Texas A&M on Saturday in the College Football Playoff.

title: Sources: Fins tried Burrow trade before '20 draft
content: The Dolphins offered the Bengals four first-round picks in 2020 for the No. 1 overall selection and the ability to take Burrow, sources told ESPN.

title: Mbapp√© ties Ronaldo record for most Real Madrid goals in a year
content: Kylian Mbapp√© added his name to another line in the record books on Saturday, tying Cristiano Ronaldo for the most goals by a Real Madrid player in a calendar year.

title: Oweh leads Kentucky rally past No. 22 St. John's
content: Otega Oweh scored 20 points to help Kentucky rally past No. 22 St. John's and former coach Rick Pitino on Saturday, 78-66.

title: Fudd, Strong lead No. 1 UConn past No. 11 Iowa
content: Azzi Fudd and Sarah Strong combined for 50 points to lead No. 1 UConn past 11th-ranked Iowa 90-64 on Saturday in the Women's Champions Classic.

title: QB Becht leaving Cyclones for 'new opportunities'
content: Quarterback Rocco Becht, who has led Iowa State to 26 wins over the past three years, says he will "pursue new opportunities for my senior season."

title: Lakers' Smart fined $35K for gesture at official
content: Lakers guard Marcus Smart was fined $35,000 for making an obscene gesture toward a game official at halftime of L.A.'s win over the Jazz on Thursday.

content: In Week 16, nine NFL teams have the chance to clinch a playoff berth. The Broncos can also lock up the AFC's No. 1 seed.

content: A disappointing end to the men's tag team championship, was emblematic of a building-block 'SmackDown.'

content: Lewis Hamilton's move to Ferrari was supposed to be a dream come true, but it became a nightmare. Will 2026's regulation change make things right?

content: Manchester City defender Josko Gvardiol is a target for Barcelona. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Risers and fallers: Add Dylan Harper, Cam Spencer for instant offense
content: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upwards or downwards, with key takeaways for each.

title: Congress nearly joined conspiracy to make Assam part of East Pakistan: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi launched a sharp attack on Congress in Guwahati, accusing the party of a pre-Independence conspiracy with the Muslim League and British to annex Assam into East Pakistan. He alleged Congress later altered Assam's demography for electoral gains, leading to encroachment on land and forests, jeopardizing the state's security and identity. Modi urged vigilance against such 'anti-national' agendas.

title: Bangladesh unrest: Protestors break into Parliament building after Hadi‚Äôs funeral; watch
content: Tensions remain high in Dhaka after a mob breached Parliament following the funeral of youth leader Sharif Osman Hadi, who was shot dead on December 12. His killing has sparked widespread unrest, with protesters demanding justice and accusing India of harboring the suspects.

title: ‚ÄòYou are wrong‚Äô: Former ASML engineer build EUV machine; contradicts CEO‚Äôs timeline
content: China has reportedly built a working prototype of an advanced chip-making machine, defying Western predictions.  Former ASML engineers are said to be behind the project, which aims for semiconductor independence. This development, a six-year government initiative, could significantly alter global chip supply chains, challenging ASML's monopoly on crucial EUV technology.

title: With 'Rishi Bankim babu', PM Modi defuses 'Bankim da' row in West Bengal
content: PM Modi addressed a virtual rally in Bengal due to fog, focusing on reassuring Matua voters and countering criticism over his "Bankim da" remark. He praised cultural icons and linked the Citizenship Amendment Act to curbing infiltration, while also highlighting development projects and contrasting Bengal's governance with Bihar's.

title: No ‚Äòsanskar‚Äô, UP police arrest 4 women after sons ‚Äòharass‚Äô teen girl
content: In Budaun, police arrested four mothers under preventive laws after their sons, all under 13, allegedly harassed a Class 8 girl. The action aims to hold parents accountable for not instilling 'good values'. Fathers, working out of state, will face arrest upon return. Legal experts question the use of preventive detention against parents.

title: Google founder‚Äôs prediction 25-yrs ago is now company‚Äôs reality: What he said about AI
content: A resurfaced 2000 video shows Google co-founder Larry Page accurately predicting the future of AI-driven search. He envisioned an "ultimate search engine" that would understand user intent and provide direct answers, a capability now realized by Gemini models. Page acknowledged the company was far from this goal then but was committed to incremental progress, leveraging vast data and computational resources.

title: Assam: Rajdhani mows down 7 jumbos in Hojai; 4 of them calves
content: A tragic collision between the Rajdhani Express and a herd of wild elephants in Assam's Hojai district resulted in the deaths of seven elephants, including four calves. The accident also derailed the train's locomotive and five coaches. While no passengers were injured, the incident has sparked calls for improved wildlife corridor safety and investigation into the cause.

title: Hijab row: Doctor whose naqab was pulled by Nitish Kumar fails to join duty
content: A woman doctor, at the center of a recent controversy involving Bihar's Chief Minister, has not reported for duty. Officials confirmed no contact with her or her family. The doctor, who was questioned about her face veil during an event, reportedly wants to avoid media attention. Her joining deadline has been extended.

title: T20 WC squad: 'Very happy' Ishan Kishan reacts to India recall as Gill misses out
content: Ishan Kishan expressed his delight after being selected for India's T20 World Cup 2026 squad, returning to the national side following a stellar Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy campaign. Suryakumar Yadav will lead the 15-member team, with Shubman Gill notably excluded due to form and fitness concerns.

title: Zuckerberg's 'highest-paid' employee is reportedly unhappy with his Boss - What he said
content: Meta's $14.8 billion investment in Scale AI and the integration of its CEO, Alexandr Wang, into a new "superintelligence" lab are reportedly facing internal friction. Wang allegedly finds Mark Zuckerberg's micromanagement "suffocating," while some staff question Wang's experience. This shift also clashes with Meta's open-source AI philosophy, leading to executive departures.

title: Will Luka Donƒçiƒá play tonight vs Clippers? Latest Lakers injury update
content: Luka Doncic's availability for the Lakers' game against the Clippers remains uncertain despite no official injury designation. With the Lakers short-handed due to multiple player absences, Doncic's role in organizing the offense and closing games becomes even more critical. This matchup against a rival is a key test for the Lakers' investment in Doncic.

title: No alliance with Sena UBT for Mumbai civic polls: Congress
content: Maharashtra Congress will not ally with Shiv Sena-UBT for BMC polls, opting instead to partner with parties like Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi. The party will contest against BJP and Shiv Sena (UBT), focusing on development and corruption issues. Alliances in other civic bodies will be decided by local leaders.

title: Anthony Joshua net worth 2025: Boxing earnings, career and Jake Paul fight payday
content: Anthony Joshua's net worth is estimated at ¬£195 million in 2025, with the majority earned from boxing purses. He also generates significant income from endorsements and property investments. Joshua is set to earn a guaranteed ¬£70 million from his upcoming fight against Jake Paul, a professionally sanctioned eight-round heavyweight bout.

title: Maple Leafs fans on edge as Auston Matthews trade talks heat up
content: Maple Leafs captain Auston Matthews is facing scrutiny as his scoring has slowed. This has sparked discussions about his future with the team. Toronto management must navigate this delicate situation. The coming months will be crucial for both Matthews and the Maple Leafs' legacy. The team aims for immediate success.

title: Vanessa Bryant net worth 2025: Wealth, legacy and life after Kobe
content: Vanessa Bryant now handles the vast financial legacy of her late husband and basketball legend, Kobe Bryant. Her net worth is estimated at $600 million as of 2025. She manages investments, endorsements, including Body Armor, and manages real estate. Vanessa also leads Granity Studios and Mamba Cita clothing and uses the money she earns from it to support young athletes. She continues brand partnerships and the Mamba & Mamba Cita Sports Foundation.

title: ‚ÄòGlobal pecking order has changed‚Äô: Jaishankar jibes Western economic model
content: EAM S Jaishankar has pointed towards a significant shift in the global economic and political hierarchy, reflecting upon India's advantage in human resources as developed nations face demographic challenges. He emphasized that India is becoming a driver of the global workforce, creating new responsibilities for governments in managing cross-border mobility and citizen welfare.

title: Trumpiana: Good cop, bad cop, all Trump - the Susie Wiles show comes to Washington
content: Starring Ice Maiden, an ‚Äúalcoholic‚Äôs‚Äù boss with ‚Äúa conspiracy theorist,‚Äù a ‚Äúright-wing absolute zealot‚Äù and an ‚Äúodd, odd duck‚Äù

title: Jitesh Sharma: A team man left behind by SKY, Gambhir and Ajit Agarkar
content: Despite doing everything asked of him, Jitesh Sharma has paid the price for India‚Äôs muddled selection calls. In the World Cup Playing XI plans a few days ago, the 32-year-old finisher was quietly dropped at the last moment, exposing a deeper lack of clarity in the team‚Äôs thinking and leaving a team man heartbroken.

title: 'Deshdrohis trying to protect infiltrators': PM Modi defends SIR at Assam rally
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday criticized the previous Congress government for neglecting Assam and the Northeast's development. He said Modi government is rectifying past mistakes and is committed to the region's progress.

title: Who is Nicole Osbourne? Inside Anthony Joshua‚Äôs split and co-parenting
content: Boxer Anthony Joshua's personal life draws attention. His son's mother, Nicole Osbourne, a dancer and yoga instructor, shares co-parenting duties. They maintain a respectful relationship focused on their son Joseph. Joshua's career demands often kept him away, contributing to their split. He remains dedicated to fatherhood amidst ongoing boxing discussions.

title: 'No embargo': Pak refutes visit restrictions on Imran's sons; promises visa approval
content: Pakistan's government has denied any restrictions on former PM Imran Khan's sons visiting him in jail, assuring visas will be granted. This follows concerns raised by his sons, who fear they may never see their father again due to alleged isolation and harsh prison conditions. Officials refuted claims of solitary confinement and solitary confinement.

title: Epstein files: Woman says she reported Jeffrey to FBI in '96; recalls seeing Trump at NY office
content: A woman's 1996 FBI complaint about Jeffrey Epstein's interest in child pornography, detailing alleged theft of her sisters' photos, was never publicly acknowledged. Maria Farmer claims federal investigators ignored her warnings for decades, only acting much later. Her testimony, now supported by an FBI report, highlights potential missed opportunities to stop Epstein's abuse sooner.

title: Savannah James says she struggled to love herself despite fame and wealth
content: LeBron James' wife, Savannah James, enjoys a massive popularity due to her husband's talent and her businesses. While the couple enjoy a luxurious life, Savannah James has admitted that she often struggles with loving herself, despite having a loving family.

title: Maharashtra horror: Nurse gang-raped after knocking on wrong hotel room; 3 accused arrested
content: A 30-year-old nurse was allegedly gang-raped by three men in a hotel room in Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar after she mistakenly knocked on their door. The accused, including two recovery agents and an MBA student, were arrested and remanded in police custody. The victim had gone to meet a friend for financial assistance when the incident occurred.

title: Kolkata chaos: Messi event derailed after 'influential person' reached stadium? What organiser said
content: Lionel Messi's event organiser, Satadru Dutta, revealed the footballer disliked physical contact, leading to his early departure. Dutta claimed an influential person disrupted crowd control plans, allowing unauthorized access. Messi reportedly received Rs 89 crore for the tour, with Rs 11 crore paid in tax. Investigations into security lapses and financial dealings are ongoing.

title: BMC polls: Congress decides to go solo; Uddhav‚ÄìRaj bonhomie strains MVA
content: The Congress party has announced it will contest the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections independently. This decision comes as Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena (UBT) and Raj Thackeray's MNS appear to be aligning, potentially to protect the Thackeray political legacy. The MVA alliance, which includes Congress, faced a significant defeat in the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly elections.

title: Unrest back home unsettles Bangladeshi visitors in Kolkata; businesses hit
content: Bangladeshi tourists in Kolkata are experiencing tension and anxiety due to fresh violence in their home country, prompting some to consider cutting short their medical trips. The renewed unrest threatens the fragile recovery of businesses in 'Mini Bangladesh,' which rely heavily on visitors from across the border.

title: India T20 World Cup squad: Why Shubman Gill was dropped - at the last moment
content: Shubman Gill's omission from India T20I World Cup squad has come as a surprise to many. The decision to drop the vice-captain from the squad was taken only a few days back and it suits everyone. Captain SKY doesn't have a high-profile player breathing down his neck, coach Gambhir will not be accused of favouritism and chief selector Ajit Agarkar has managed to reward a domestic performer.

title: Social media ban: Can India mirror Aus model? Promise, pitfalls, and practicality
content: Australia has enacted a law prohibiting social media use for those under 16, a move sparking global debate. While parents largely support it, youth oppose it. India faces similar discussions, with challenges in implementing a ban due to its vast population and digital integration.

title: 'Attack on interests of poor': Sonia Gandhi slams PM Modi over VB-G RAM G Bill
content: Congress leader Sonia Gandhi has strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government. She claims the new VB-G RAM G Bill replaces MGNREGA and harms the poor. The government states the new law improves upon MGNREGA, which it says was plagued by corruption. The opposition protested the bill's passage in Parliament.

title: From insurance to SIPs to retirement: How Parliament‚Äôs Winter Session rewrote your financial future
content: Parliament has enacted sweeping financial reforms, including 100% foreign ownership in insurance and pension firms, to boost domestic investment amidst global trade tensions. These changes aim to lower costs for consumers, improve product offerings, and channel capital into India's growth story, promising a more competitive and efficient financial landscape.

title: German couple detained for 'illegal religious conversions' near India-Pakistan border
content: Six individuals, including a German couple, were detained in Sriganganagar for alleged illegal religious conversions. The group was found in a rented house in Srikaranpur, a town near the India-Pakistan border. Authorities are investigating the German nationals' presence in a restricted border zone without authorization.

title: Why Shubman Gill missed out on T20 World Cup 2026 selection: Ajit Agarkar breaks silence
content: Shubman Gill has been excluded from India's T20 World Cup squad due to his recent lack of form. Axar Patel has been appointed vice-captain, while Ishan Kishan returns as the second wicketkeeper and reserve opener. Rinku Singh is back as the designated finisher.

title: UP shocker: Teen boy ‚Äòslammed on floor‚Äô by hospital staff after kin refuse to pay bribe
content: A 14-day-old infant's body was exhumed in Pilibhit following allegations of deliberate harm by hospital staff over an unpaid bribe. Parents claim the child was dropped, while hospital officials deny this, stating a vacuum extraction led to swelling mistaken for injury. The father alleges threats after reporting the incident, prompting a magistrate-ordered autopsy for clarity.

title: Xavier Worthy car collection: Inside Chiefs WR‚Äôs $1M-plus luxury garage
content: Kansas City Chiefs star Xavier Worthy's luxury car collection, reportedly valued over $1 million, includes a Rolls-Royce Phantom, Dodge Charger, Mercedes SUV, and a Bugatti. This comes after his expensive car was stolen from a downtown garage in May 2024. Worthy recently unveiled a custom-built garage showcasing his football journey.

title: Sivakarthikeyan moves Madras high court over Rs 15 cr payment dispute
content: Actor Sivakarthikeyan has found himself in a legal battle with Studio Green Films, as he files a case in the Madras High Court for Rs 15 crore in outstanding payments for the film 'Mr. Local'.

title: T20 World Cup squad: Captain Suryakumar speaks up on his form; remarks after Gill's omission
content: Ahead of the T20 World Cup, selectors dropped Shubman Gill, prioritizing impact players and quick starts. Ishan Kishan and Rinku Singh return, while captain Suryakumar Yadav, despite recent lean form, expressed confidence in his batting resurgence. The team aims for stronger performances from its leader as they prepare to defend their title.

title: Opposition expresses concern as key posts in U.P. Minorities Commission remain vacant
content: The prolonged vacancy in the Uttar Pradesh Commission for Minorities  naturally raises concerns about institutional functionality and access to justice for all minority communities, says SP leader

content: The U.P. CM cautioned people against falling prey to such agents, warning that illegal attempts to go abroad often lead to imprisonment

content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy want to know whether the development activities had in any way affected nesting by migratory and inhabitant birds

title: Clear vote-share lead in Ernakulam district panchayat makes UDF dominance evident
content: The UDF‚Äôs vote share reflects the sweeping victory the front scored in the local body elections, winning 25 of the 28 seats, while the LDF was restricted to the remaining three

title: The quiet climb to the helm
content: The appointment of the 45-year-old Minister from Bihar as the BJP‚Äôs new national working president, close on the heels of the NDA‚Äôs big victory in the State Assembly elections, signals a generational shift within the party organisation

title: Over half of elector deletions in T.N. concentrated in eight districts in two clusters
content: Even though the Chennai and Tiruppur clusters saw the highest removals, the impact on their share of Tamil Nadu‚Äôs total elector base was relatively limited

title: Stalin inaugurates Porunai Archaeological Museum
content: The museum showcases ancient Tamil artefacts from Adichanallur, Sivakalai, Korkai, and Thulukkarpatti

title: CBI arrests Lt. Col. with Department of Defence Productions on graft charge
content: The CBI recovered the alleged bribe amount and seized ‚Çπ2.23 crore in cash from his Delhi house and ‚Çπ10 lakh from his house in Sri Ganganagar, in addition to other incriminating material, as alleged

title: Why Congress walks out of MVA in Mumbai ‚Äî and how it reshapes the civic contest
content: The move has changed the electoral combinations in a multipolar contest where all parties have high stakes.

content: Temple security personnel noticed the camera-equipped glasses and promptly intercepted Thiruneepanar, who was later handed over to Fort police

title: CJI to hold special vacation sitting on December 22 to hear urgent cases
content: Supreme Court is usually closed from December 19 till January 5 and no judicial work is done during this period

title: Quota for ex-Agniveers in CAPF will not impact existing matrix, says govt. official
content: Alliance of All Ex-Paramilitary Association expresses opposition to the reservation as they say it will affect the chances of other candidates

title: Claims of fake votes, fraud mar local body polls in Maharashtra
content: Special investigations and police action launched in several districts over poll chaos and electoral fraud allegations; results for all 286 municipal councils and¬†nagar¬†panchayats expected on December 21

title: Centre plans Vande Mataram-themed Republic Day fete; EU leaders invited as chief guests
content: Top EU leaders have been invited for the 77th Republic Day celebrations; EU-India Summit planned on the sidelines to finalise the much-delayed Free Trade Agreement (FTA); multiple Ministries tasked with promotion and rebranding push

title: West Bengal Government renames State‚Äôs job guarantee scheme as ‚ÄòMahatma-Shree‚Äô to honour Mahatma Gandhi
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announces the move in response to the Union Government renaming MGNREGA

title: Where Centre helps, will thank them: Omar Abdullah
content: Omar Abdullah‚Äôs recent remarks that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has been liberal with funding for economically disadvantaged J&K, drew sharp reactions from leaders of the Peoples Democratic Party and the J&K Peoples Conference

title: Weighed down by grief: How Maharashtra residents are trying to fight malnutrition and lack of medical infrastructure
content: In Maharashtra‚Äôs tribal-dominated Melghat region, residents are grappling with the loss of their children due to malnutrition and delay in receiving medical care. Inadequate health infrastructure, lack of specialists, and belief in traditional healers pose challenges in reducing the high infant mortality rate, finds Snehal Mutha

title: Court grants anticipatory bail to director Kunju Muhammad in molestation case
content: Case against director following complaint that he had allegedly molested a woman at a hotel where they were staying to select Malayalam films for IFFK

title: Over 150 families left homeless after demolition drive in Yelahanka
content: Bengaluru Solid Waste Management Limited says the demolition drive is conducted to clear encroachments on government land¬†

title: Cultural resistance required to protect Constitution and democracy: Kerala CM
content: The Citizenship Amendment Act and the idea of ‚ÄòOne Nation, One Election‚Äô are attempts to destroy federalism, the Chief Minister alleges in his inaugural address at the Indian Cultural Congress 2025, organised by the Department of Culture, in Kochi

title: Law commission chief calls for Indianisation of legal system
content: At talk at Lok Bhavan, he says it is high time that the Indian justice delivery system is overhauled, making it Bharatiya

title: Andhra Pradesh notifies sweeping amendments to building rules
content: Changes aimed at enhancing urban safety, promoting green construction, and improving ease of doing business through technology-driven approvals and clearer norms for high-rise projects, says official

title: Navi Mumbai Airport's Dress Rehearsal Before First Flight On December 25
content: With five days to go before the first flight takes off from Navi Mumbai International Airport, the NMIA is preparing start operations on December 25, a globally recognised readiness programme.

title: 129 Delhi Airport Flights Cancelled Due To Dense Fog
content: At least 129 flights were cancelled at the Delhi airport on Saturday due to dense fog, according to an official. Flight operations have been disrupted for the past several days at Delhi and other airports due to dense fog, resulting in low visibility

title: Chhattisgarh BJP Leader Files Complaint Over "Fabricated" Video
content: A series of viral posts and videos have surfaced on social media alleging that BJP senior leader and National Working President Nitin Naveen collected Rs 1,500 crore from Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai.

title: Delhi Gets Its First Cold Wave, Maximum Temperature At 16.9 Degrees Celsius
content: Delhi experienced its first cold wave of the season on Saturday, recording its coldest December day this year as the maximum temperature plunged to 16.9 degrees Celsius, 5.3 notches below normal.

title: "Do Not Say One Thing In Delhi, Another In Kashmir": Omar Abdullah
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah today reiterated his praise for the Narendra Modi government for its liberal funding to the union territory, insisting that his praise is not meant to please anybody.

title: In Meghalaya Honeymoon Murder Case, Sonam Raghuvanshi's Bail Plea Rejected Again
content: The high-profile murder case of Raja Raghuvanshi has taken a decisive turn with the rejection of the bail plea of his wife - Sonam Raghuvanshi - who is the accused in his murder, for the third time.

title: PM Modi's Bengal Address Decoded: Energising Cadre, Countering Mamata Banerjee
content: For the upcoming election in West Bengal, Prime Minister Narendra Modi remains the strongest brand equity for the state BJP in countering Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and her party, Trinamool Congress.

title: No Van To Pick Her Up, Schoolgirl Blocks Road In Protest For 3 Hours
content: On a quiet road in Madhya Pradesh's Betul district, traffic came to a standstill on Saturday as a 10-year-old girl blocked the road inprotest after her school van failed to arrive.

title: Christian Michel Gets Bail In Agusta Westland Money Laundering Case
content: The Rouse Avenue court on Saturday ordered to release Christian Michel James from custody in the alleged money laundering case linked with Augusta Westland chopper deal case.

title: ISRO Completes Drogue Parachute Tests For Gaganyaan Crew Module
content: ISRO has completed a series of qualification tests for Drogue Parachutes for the development of deceleration system of Gaganyaan Crew Module.

title: Rats Spotted in Newborn Care Unit of District Hospital In Madhya Pradesh
content: Days after a video showing rats roaming freely in the ICU and orthopedic ward of Jabalpur's Victoria Hospital triggered public outrage, a similar and deeply disturbing incident has now surfaced from Satna district in Madhya Pradesh.

title: "Mob Rule Should Not Prevail":  Shashi Tharoor Slams Violence In Bangladesh
content: Congress MP and Chairperson of the Parliamentary Standing Committee on External Affairs, Shashi Tharoor, on Saturday strongly condemned the violence in Bangladesh.

title: Guwahati Gets India's First "Nature-Themed Airport"
content: The new terminal building of the Lokapriya Gopinath Bardoloi International Airport, inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday, is the "country's first nature-themed airport."

title: PM Modi Defends Voter Roll Revision, Says Exercise Aims At Fair Polls
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday launched a sharp attack on the Congress, accusing the party of neglecting the development of the Northeast for decades, a failure he said had serious implications for national security.

title: How NDTV's 'Indian Of The Year' Madhavi Lata Helped Build World's Highest Rail Bridge
content: From a barefoot girl in a remote Andhra village who once sold old notebooks for 40 paise to buy kerosene to a celebrated scientist shaping India's engineering marvels - Professor Madhavi Latha's journey is nothing short of extraordinary.

title: Nearly 300 Families Stranded In This Delhi Locality After Sealing Drive By UP Body
content: On December 15, officials of the Uttar Pradesh Irrigation Department, accompanied by the Delhi Police, Uttar Pradesh Police, and paramilitary forces, conducted a large-scale sealing operation in Aali Gaon in Delhi.

title: Villagers To Hold Day-Long Fast To Protest Top Court's Aravalli Ruling
content: The #SaveAravalli movement has exploded across social media, trending nationwide and rallying thousands from rural communities, environmentalists to politicians.

title: Congress Leader Says Party To Contest Mumbai Civic Body Polls Independently
content: Congress party in charge of Maharashtra, Ramesh Chennithala, on Saturday announced that the party will contest the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections on its own strength.

title: 'His Blood Won't Go In Vain': Crowds At Funeral Of Bangladesh Leader
content: From dawn, groups of people arrived towards Manik Mia Avenue, quickly filling the area outside the Parliament complex. Many draped themselves in the national flag, while others shouted demands for accountability over Hadi's killing.

title: New Epstein Files Refer To "Massage Techniques", Ayurveda From India
content: The newly released Epstein files have references to what they described as "massage techniques" and Ayurveda from India.

content: A senior officer cautioned that with the New Year approaching, cybercrimes might mushroom in the name of attractive offers

content: Jharkhand Health Minister Irfan Ansari offers the doctor a government job with a monthly salary of ‚Çπ3 lakh and a posting of her choice

title: 13th Sargaalaya Arts and Crafts Festival from Dec. 23
content: Artisans from 15 countries to take part. Flower show, Tourism Expo to be held for the first time as part of the festival

title: Thrissur to host 64th Kerala School Arts Festival
content: Five-day extravaganza to be held from January 14 to 18 across 25 venues with competitions in 239 items

title: All eyes on Independent collective at Pala
content: After the oath-taking, the collective plans a ‚ÄòJanasabha‚Äô to assess community support before finalising its political stance, amid speculation of a possible alliance with the UDF.

title: Walayar mob lynching: rights activists allege bid to trivialise crime, demand ‚Çπ25 lakh compensation
content: Protest meeting in Thrissur calls the killing of Chhattisgarh native Ram Narayan a chilling reflection of growing Islamophobia in the State

title: Majority and minority communalism have to be resisted, says Kerala CM

title: Chandrababu Naidu sets Swachh targets, says Andhra Pradesh will be plastic-free by June next and roads garbage-free by January 26
content: Stressing the need for adopting a circular economy through which waste is recycled, the Chief Minister has appealed to the people to be a part of it for the benefit of the future generations

title: Kerala local body polls: LDF leads in vote share of fronts in Thiruvananthapuram district
content: The LDF received 37.27% of the votes in panchayats, compared to the UDF‚Äôs 35.30%, while the BJP-led NDA got 21.59%. In the Thiruvananthapuram Corporation, the NDA won 34.52%  of the votes and 50 seats, but the LDF captured a marginally higher vote share of 34.65%.

title: Quality of civil services decisive for Viksit Bharat, says Vice-President
content: Implementation of national priorities depends on the quality of administrators selected today, says C. P. Radhakrishnan

title: Trump signs law, wants India‚Äôs nuclear liability aligned with global norms
content: U.S. President tells Secretary of State to establish mechanism to ‚Äòassess the implementation‚Äô of 2008 nuclear deal; Congress says PM Modi ‚Äòbulldozed‚Äô SHANTI Bill to make peace with ‚Äòonce good friend‚Äô

title: RTC union seeks steps to reduce increased workload after launch of ‚ÄòStree Shakti‚Äô scheme
content: If problems are not addressed immediately, it will become difficult for the RTC bus crew to continue their duties, says APPTD president

title: Earlier, untouchability was a thing to shame people; now it is reservation: Neeraj Ghaywan
content: ‚ÄúEarlier, untouchability was a thing to shame people; now it is reservation quota. It feels like reservation is a privilege that has been accorded- It is not a poverty alleviation programme. It is a reparation for a 2,000-year-old injustice,‚Äù says Neeraj Ghaywan at The Hindu Mind

title: Gen Z and the fading Christmas, New Year card tradition
content: Vendors selling Christmas cards in Kozhikode are no longer able to drive sales as they once did, as a significant shift in gifting habits has occurred due to the generational gap

title: Collector forms panel to monitor worsening air quality in Visakhapatnam
content: Instructs officials to take immediate steps to control the deteriorating air quality; directs GVMC officials to ensure that vehicles transporting garbage are fully covered with tarpaulin, urges citizens to segregate wet and dry waste before handing it over to sanitation workers

title: Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan talks tough against those issuing threats to contractors, bureaucrats in Andhra Pradesh
content: Referring to YSRCP president Jagan Mohan Reddy‚Äôs threat that those partnering with the government to run medical colleges in the PPP mode will be sent to jail if he is voted to power, the Deputy Chief Minister warns of adopting zero tolerance approach, similar to the one being followed by Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath towards scriminals

title: Researchers at Cusat granted patent for advanced digital evidence fingerprinting system
content: The system reportedly strengthens conventional digital evidence hashing techniques by integrating multiple security parameters

title: Madras High Court amici curiae to inspect site for proposed 184-feet-tall Lord Murugan statue at Marudhamalai
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy ask the amici curiae to submit their inspection report by January 23

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who intends to transfer
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Proof that Texas A&M volleyball's run is more methodical than magical
content: all-America hitter ava Underwood hoisted her in the air . the Aggies survived another marathon postseason set . they knocked off no. 1 seed Pittsburgh 29-27, 25-21, 25-20 in the final four .

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Bo Nix and six other potential playoff heroes
content: the spectacle of the ring and the vibrant characters that bring it to life loom large over the zeitgeist . it's testament to brilliant marketing, engaging storytelling and continued commitment to craft . xFP leaderboard | xTD leaderboard .

title: 'OK, now tap your smiley face': How Kentucky's Eva Hudson is finding joy in the game
content: it's match point in the fifth set of the NCAA women's college volleyball semifinals between no.1 seed Kentucky and no. 3 seed Wisconsin . the Badgers blocked the shot out of bounds, but Hudson's power was too much for even the best defenders .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Updated 1-32 poll, holiday gifts for each team
content: the Colorado Avalanche remain on top of the ESPN NHL Power Rankings . it's the holiday gifting season, which means what better time than now to hand out a gift to all 32 teams . a panel of commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday .

title: 4th elephant death on rail tracks this year, toll rises to 94 since 2019
content: this was the fourth such accident this year . the last two accidents were reported from Jalpaiguri in west Bengal . 81 elephants were killed after being hit by a train between 2019-20 and 2023-24 .

title: After the last landing: Where do planes go to die?
content: an aircraft's story does not end at the horizon, but what happens then? do planes have a grave, as we humans do? is it dismantled piece by piece or kept in a museum like a relic from another era?

title: Follow live: Jalen Hurts finds DeVonta Smith as Eagles take lead
content: Saturday's NFL Week 16 action continues with two matchups between the Eagles and Commanders, and Bears and Packers. Here are highlights from the day:

title: Sources: Rams fire ST coordinator after TNF loss
content: new: the move marks the first in-season coaching change that the coach has made in his nine seasons in Los Angeles . new: he will take over and become the lead special teams coach, a source says . the team lost to the seahawks on friday night in a game that included a punt return for a touchdown .

title: CFP first-round takeaways: Miami finds its run game and capitalizes on A&M mistakes
content: we're halfway through the four first-round games of the 2025 college football playoff . nip-and-tuck ballgames with wild special teams swings and a pair of road victors . Alabama pulled off a 17-point comeback to beat Oklahoma 34-24 on Friday night .
